event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU), the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: A non-fatal uncorrectable error was detected within a MBC chip.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
A non-fatal uncorrectable error was detected within a MBC chip.


SPARC Enterprise M3000 platform:
   

    The domain may panic due to an uncorrectable error and the platform becomes unbootable.

    There is only one XSB on the M3000 platform.

     If the fault was detected on the MBC chip of the Motherboard Unit (MBU)
     and the fault affects the entire MBC chip or the entire MBU (this is indicated by the
     fact that the FMRI of the fault is the entire MBC chip):  No immediate action is taken.
     The platform becomes unbootable.

     Any future faults on the MBU cannot be diagnosed, because the MBC is required for diagnosis. 

     If the fault was detected while running POST (this is indicated by a payload property for the
     ereport/fault report), and the fault is not on the TTY-oriented part of the MBC chip, then this
     XSB will not be used for communication between the XSCF and the domain
     The domain will  not be booted and will be powered off.




   SPARC Enterprise M4000 platform:


     If the fault was detected on the MBC chip of the Motherboard Unit (MBU) and the fault affects
     the entire MBC chip or the entire MBU (this is indicated by the fact that the FMRI of the fault
     is the entire MBC chip):   No immediate action is taken.
     The platform becomes unbootable.

     Any future faults on the MBU cannot be diagnosed, because the MBC is required for diagnosis. 

     If the fault was detected while running POST (this is indicated by a payload property for the
     ereport/fault report), and the fault is not on the TTY-oriented part of the MBC chip, then this
     XSB will not be used for communication between the XSCF and the domain, and the SCF
     software will use another XSB for communication. If there is no other XSB available in the
     domain with the appropriately functioning interface,  then the domain will  not be booted and
      will be powered off.

     If the fault is on the SRAM of the MBC chip, then any of the domains on the platform may panic
     due to an uncorrectable error.  The platform will gradually become unbootable because domains
     will not be allowed to reboot.

     If the fault is on the part of the MBC chip dealing with a specific XSB,  then the domain using the
     XSB may panic due to the uncorrectable error.  The XSB is deconfigured after the domain using the
     XSB reboots or after the domain stops using the XSB due to a DR operation.

     If the fault was detected on the MBC chip of an IOU  (this can be determined by examining the
     FMRI of the fault),  then no immediate action is taken.  However, any future faults on the IOU
     cannot be diagnosed (because the MBC  is required for diagnosis). 
     The platform will gradually become unbootable as domains try to reboot.



   SPARC Enterprise M5000 platform:


     If the fault was detected on the MBC chip of the Motherboard Unit (MBU) and the fault affects
     the entire MBC chip or the entire MBU (this is indicated by the fact that the ASRU of the fault is
     the entire MBU): No immediate action is taken.
     The platform becomes unbootable.

     Any future faults on the MBU cannot be diagnosed, because the MBC is required for diagnosis. 

     If the fault was detected on the MBC chip of the MBU and the fault affects the entire MBC chip
     (this is indicated by the fact that the FMRI of the fault is the entire MBC chip), but the fault does not
     affect the entire MBU  (the ASRU of the fault is also the entire MBC chip): The half the Motherboard
     with the faulty MBC chip is deconfigured after the domains using the half the Motherboard reboot
     or the domains stop using the half the Motherboard due to DR operations.

     If the fault was detected while running POST (this is indicated by a payload property for the
     ereport/fault report), and the fault is not on the TTY-oriented part of the MBC chip, then this
     XSB will not be used for communication between the XSCF and the domain, and the SCF
     software will use another XSB for communication. If there is no other XSB available in the
     domain with the appropriately functioning interface,  then the domain will  not be booted and
     will be powered off.
    
     If the fault is on the SRAM of the MBC chip, the half the Motherboard with the MBC chip is
     deconfigured after the domains using the half the Motherboard reboot or after the domains
     stop using the half the Motherboard due to DR operations.

     If the fault is on the part of the MBC chip dealing with a specific XSB,  then the domain using the
     XSB may panic due to the uncorrectable error.  The XSB is deconfigured after the domain using the
     XSB reboots or after the domain stops using the XSB due to a DR operation.

     If the fault was detected on the MBC chip of an IOU  (this can be determined by examining the
     FMRI of the fault),  then no immediate action is taken.  However, any future faults on the IOU
     cannot be diagnosed (because the MBC  is required for diagnosis). 
     The platform will gradually become unbootable as domains try to reboot.



   SPARC Enterprise M8000 platform:

      If the fault involves the MBC chip on an IOU (this can be determined by
      examining the FMRI of the fault), then the IOU will be deconfigured
      after the platform is power cycled or after the domains using the IOU
      are rebooted or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation.
 
      If the fault involves the MBC chip on a BP_A (this can be determined by
      examining the FMRI of the fault), then the platform will become unbootable.

      If the fault involves the MBC chip on a CMU, and is confined to the part
      of the MBC chip that is used as a TTY (console) interface (this can be
      determined by examining the FMRI of the fault), then the TTY interface
      will be switched to an XSB in the domain that has a working TTY interface.
      The CMU with the MBC chip will be deconfigured after the platform is power cycled
      or after the domains using the CMU are rebooted or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation.

      If the fault involves the MBC chip on the CMU, and is confined to the part
      of the MBC chip that deals with a single XSB (this can be determined
      by examining the FMRI of the fault), then the XSB will be deconfigured.

      If the fault involves the MBC chip on the CMU and affects the entire MBC
      chip (this can be determined by examining the FMRI of the fault), then
      the CMU with the MBC chip will be deconfigured after the platform is
      power cycled or after the domains using the CMU are rebooted or after a
      Dynamic Reconfiguration operation.



   SPARC Enterprise M9000-32 platform:

      If the fault involves the MBC chip on an IOU (this can be determined by
      examining the FMRI of the fault), then the IOU will be deconfigured
      after the platform is power cycled or after the domains using the IOU
      are rebooted or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation.

      If the fault involves the MBC chip on a CLKU (this can be determined by
      examining the FMRI of the fault), then the CLKU will be deconfigured
      after the platform is power cycled.

      If the fault involves the MBC chip on a XBU (this can be determined by
      examining the FMRI of the fault), then the crossbar way will be
      deconfigured after the platform is power cycled. If this is the first
      crossbar way to be deconfigured, the platform will operate with reduced
      performance. If a crossbar way has already been deconfigured, the
      platform will become unbootable.

      If the fault involves the MBC chip on a CMU, and is confined to the part
      of the MBC chip that is used as a TTY (console) interface (this can be
      determined by examining the FMRI of the fault), then the TTY interface
      will be switched to an XSB in the domain that has a working TTY interface.
      The CMU with the MBC chip will be deconfigured after the domains using
      the CMU are rebooted. The deconfiguration is not persistent across platform
      power cycles or across a Dynamic Reconfiguration operations.

      If the fault involves the MBC chip on the CMU, and is confined to the part
      of the MBC chip that deals with a single XSB (this can be determined
      by examining the FMRI of the fault), then the XSB will be deconfigured.

      If the fault involves the MBC chip on the CMU and affects the entire MBC
      chip (this can be determined by examining the FMRI of the fault), then
      the CMU with the MBC chip will be deconfigured after the platform is
      power cycled or after the domains using the CMU are rebooted or after a
      Dynamic Reconfiguration operation.



   SPARC Enterprise M9000-64 platform:

      If the fault involves the MBC chip on an IOU (this can be determined by
      examining the FMRI of the fault), then the IOU will be deconfigured
      after the platform is power cycled or after the domains using the IOU
      are rebooted or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation.

      If the fault involves the MBC chip on a CLKU (this can be determined by
      examining the FMRI of the fault), then the CLKU and its partner CLKU on
      the other cabinet will be deconfigured after the platform is power cycled.

      If the fault involves the MBC chip on a XBU (this can be determined by
      examining the FMRI of the fault), then the crossbar way will be
      deconfigured after the platform is power cycled. If this is the first
      crossbar way to be deconfigured, the platform will operate with reduced
      performance. If a crossbar way has already been deconfigured, the
      platform will become unbootable.

      If the fault involves the MBC chip on a XSCFU_C (this can be determined
      by examining the FMRI of the fault) and there is a standby XSCFU, the
      XSCFU will fail over to the standby XSCFU. If there is no standby XSCFU,
      then the platform will become unbootable.

      If the fault involves the MBC chip on a CMU, and is confined to the part
      of the MBC chip that is used as a TTY (console) interface (this can be
      determined by examining the FMRI of the fault), then the TTY interface
      will be switched to an XSB in the domain that has a working TTY
      interface. The CMU with the MBC chip will be deconfigured after the
      platform is power cycled or after the domains using the CMU are rebooted
      or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation.

      If the fault involves the MBC chip on the CMU, and is confined to the part
      of the MBC chip that deals with a single XSB (this can be determined
      by examining the FMRI of the fault), then the XSB will be deconfigured.

      If the fault involves the MBC chip on the CMU and affects the entire MBC
      chip (this can be determined by examining the FMRI of the fault), then
      the CMU with the MBC chip will be deconfigured after the platform is
      power cycled or after the domains using the CMU are rebooted or after a
      Dynamic Reconfiguration operation.




The recommended service action for this event is to schedule the replacement of the affected FRU.

       LEGEND

      RED        = SUNW-MSG-ID
      BLUE     = EVENT_ID
      GREEN  = FRU


Step 1. Collect the fault message (use one of the following methods):


   Single-line fault message displayed on the XSCF console:

   Mar 20 21:22:21 san-ff2-21-0 fmd: SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12, CSN: 7860000772  
   EVENT-ID: fcbb859a-a6c8-44d2-abf1-f53f14e946b3
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8003-LS for detailed information.


   Complete fault message using 'fmdump -m' on the XSCF console:

   MSG-ID: SCF-8003-LS, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Critical
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 20 21:22:21 UTC 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: 7860000772, HOSTNAME: san-ff2-21-0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: fcbb859a-a6c8-44d2-abf1-f53f14e946b3
   DESC: A non-fatal uncorrectable error was detected within a MBC chip.
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8003-LS for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: No immediate action is taken by XSCF software due to this fault.
   Resources associated with the faulty FRU will be deconfigured after the platform is
   power cycled or after the domain reboots or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation
   is performed. This resource deconfiguration may cause the platform to become
   unbootable. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
   IMPACT: The non-fatal uncorrectable error trap may cause the domain to panic.
   REC-ACTION: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU),
   the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.


Step 2. Collect the output from the 'fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID' command

   
   SPARC Enterprise platform example:
 
   xscf> fmdump -v -u fcbb859a-a6c8-44d2-abf1-f53f14e946b3

         TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
         Mar 20 21:22:21.7525 fcbb859a-a6c8-44d2-abf1-f53f14e946b3 SCF-8003-LS
           100%  fault.chassis.SPARC-Enterprise.asic.mbc.se

                 Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/cmu=0/mbc=0
                    Affects: hc:///chassis=0/cmu=0/xsb=0
                        FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=7860000772:
                             server-id=san-ff2-21-0:
                             part=CA20393-B50X 001AA:revision=0101/component=/MBU_B



Step 3. Contact your Authorized Service Provider.



If you require additional information, please refer to InfoDoc #87402.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: The non-fatal uncorrectable error trap may cause the domain to panic.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: No immediate action is taken by XSCF software due to this fault. Resources associated with the faulty FRU will be deconfigured after the platform is power cycled or after the domain reboots or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed. This resource deconfiguration may cause the platform to become unbootable. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: Non-fatal uncorrectable error was detected within a MBC chip.
